alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 6:57AM CDT until June 25 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN JOHNSON COUNTY... At 657 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen in the Lake Macbride and Solon areas. Flash flooding was reported earlier on the Herbert Hoover Highway on ramp to Interstate 80. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Iowa City, Coralville, North Liberty, Solon, Tiffin, University Heights, Swisher, Oxford, Hills, Shueyville, Oakdale, Lake Macbride State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 233 and 251. This includes the following streams and drainages... Knapp Creek, Big Slough, Iowa River, Wapsinonoc Creek, North Branch Old Mans Creek, Clear Creek, Old Womans Creek, Sanders Creek, Swisher Creek, Rapid Creek, Buffalo Creek, Buck Creek, Snyder Creek, Rhine Creek, Ralston Creek, Jordan Creek, Turkey Creek, Dirty Face Creek, Lingle Creek, Old Mans Creek, West Hoosier Creek, South Hoosier Creek and Pechman Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
